title: ESR dating confirms the original assessment that this site is Middle Pleistocene in age (Li and Etler 1992). Nanzhao: “Southern” taxa such as Tapirus and Rhinoceros sinensis are present, along with others found mainly in North China, such as Megaceros pachyosteus, Equus sanmeniensis, and Canis lupus. Jianshi Fossil Bed 3: This also has evidence of Ailuripoda, Equus yunnanensis, Tapirus sinensis, Rhinoceros sp., and Stegodon sp. Fossil bed 2 directly overlies this and contains teeth of Gigantopithecus blacki and remains of Tapirus sinensis, Equus yunnanensis, and Stegodon sp. The faunal assemblage from fossil bed 1 also contains teeth of Gigantopithecus but is from a different part of the cave, and might be considerably older, as it has evidence of Gompotheriidae, a primitive Proboscidean normally found in Miocene and Pliocene contexts
